OOC: Sorry for my delay. I had some internet problems on the ISP's end of things.
   
  ::Dark Rodimus/Jhiaxus/Scorponok-Zarak::
   
  Jhiaxus had left the briefing room and was heading for where Nightlight's cell. He is passing Dark Rodimus in hall when Perceptor signals red alert.
   
  Jhiaxus: It took the bafoons long enough. Rodimus, stay near the main doors but do not reveal yourself yet. You will be our surprise!
   
  Rodimus: Understood, Lord Jhiaxus. For the empire!
   
  Jhiaxus runs and makes his way outside where all the activity is.
   
  Jhiaxus: Maximal cruiser on incoming. All hands ready for combat!
   
  Zarak: What timeing on all of this...
   
  Zarak gets into the Scorponok cockpit ready for battle.
   
  Rodimus has positioned himself just inside the Black Fortress' main doors.

xochitla2006 <xochitla2006@...> wrote:
          Hydras:

"Why not say anything Perseus? do you want them back, truE? well I'll 
exchange them... Sorry, i forgot that one wont be able to comeback... 
well, one of them for your city and your people. if just one is so 
value for you to come here then you must give us your city..."

Hydras shut up the com link and looking Jhiaxus said "You should 
better to and have some fun with our guest, I just ask you dont kill 
her... I just would have some fun for my self "

Hydras left the place and starte to walk towards the exit, he opened 
his comlink and said "here is hydras, what's going on outside? I'll 
join to party right now" 

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> 
wrote:
>
> OOC: I am not sure what Trelos, Jhiaxus or Scorponok are doing in 
the
> midst of this conversation, but I will continue as I can :)
> 
> BIC:
> 
> Myrmidon frowned as he recieved no answer from Hydras. This was not 
the
> first time he felt Hydras was not acting in the manner his instincts
> were telling him Megatron would have acted, but that feeling was
> becoming more pronounced as he watched the display of this Megatron 
X. 
> 
> With a growl he put that aside as he returned his hard gaze to the
> Decepticon before him, "What is your answer intruder, stand before
> Hydras or fall beneath our firepower?!"
> 
> Preston
> (Myrmidon)
> 
> 
> --- Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:
> 
> > Myrmidon watched the display of Megatron with a cold expression,
> > crimson optics unflinching. 
> > 
> > However inside things were much different. A cecophony of thoughts
> > and
> > memories flooded his consciousness as he watched, the name 
Megatron
> > floating amongst the wave. A constant litanty, part statement part
> > question, "Megatron, who is the true Megaton." 
> > 
> > It was as if somthing in his programing was attempting to 
emerge. It
> > reminded him of how he felt when he first emerged here, and that
> > drive
> > to find Megatron, but more pronounced. When he heard from Hydras 
in
> > the
> > begining he thought his duty was answered, and yet now perhaps 
there
> > was doubt. 
> > 
> > It was as if there was something he was suppose to do or remember,
> > but
> > he could not . . . yet!
> > 
> > With a shake of his head he cleared his thoughts as the image of
> > Megatron faded. In frustration and a desire to cover his 
distraction
> > he
> > grunted and spoke over his radio, "Hydras, you had better if get 
out
> > here if you wish to resolve this as you had hoped!"
> > 
> > Preston
> > (Myrmidon)
> > 
> > --- Robert Riley <chiyohakuryuu@...> wrote:
> > 
> > > Malice:
> > > 
> > > Dodging Trelos while hovering in vehicle mode was in no way 
easy. 
> > He
> > > recieved signifigant scratches to his ventral heatshielding, 
but in
> > a
> > > few minutes it would be repaired. In the meantime he 
transformed
> > and
> > > focused his attention to Myrmidon. A small panel on his chest
> > opened
> > > and a communication holo emitter. He made contact with Megatron
> > via
> > > internal radio, and the image of the large and powerful 
Megatron X
> > > stood before Myrmidon. Body very different, but his head and 
faced
> > > almost unchanged, save for a youthful countance.
> > > 
> > > "*Hmm? WHo are these creatures? They look like slag in a slag
> > heap.
> > > Ah, I see now, they cower under that Hydras, huh? Hmpt! 
Pitiful
> > > excuses for Decepticons. They can't conquer Prehistory Earth, 
what
> > > would make them suitable to follow me?*"
> > > 
> > > "I don't know, they talk an awful lot. Maybe you should give 
thema
> > > chance?"
> > > 
> > > "*YOU give them a second chance. I'm dealing with more 
important
> > > matters!*"
> > 
> > 
> > 
> > 
> >
>
